Is 'non-proxy hosts' common terminology? How does the user work with multiple non-proxy hosts? If it is, e.g. comma-separated, would it be better for the API to be varargs or a List?
nonProxyHosts is what Java uses for host that should ignore the environment configured proxy, I chose this to stay inline with language specifics.

This is expected to be a regex based on the documentation for http.nonProxyHosts (the Java environment variable for this). Our AZURE_NO_PROXY environment variable doesn't state the expected format, only statement made is that is must support CIDR annotation.
I wonder if we should call this fromConfiguration, that feels a little more Java idiomatic
